Interview Questions: Typical questions were asked as well as questions regarding how one would respond to or approach various scenarios relevant to the position.  A very good combination of questions & information was present.

title: Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Clinton Health Access Initiative (Boston, MA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted a week after submitting my application. I was informed the interview would last approximately 30 min and they were very transparent with salaries and explained other benefits upfront which I appreciated. Next, I was given a technical exercise which would need to be completed within 3 hours. It consisted of analyzing quantitative and qualitative information using Excel, and then presenting the information on Word and Memo. I found it was challenging as the instructions are ambiguous. It's been 3 weeks and I haven't heard back so I'm not sure if I did well.
Interview Questions: They asked the basic interview questions such as "Why do you want to work for CHAI? Tell me about a time when you deal with someone who was difficult and how did you handle it?"

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Clinton Health Access Initiative in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: I have an initial Skype call with someone from the HR department. They followed up with me within the week, asking a writing example. Then, I have a second Skype call with the hiring manager from the department of the internship. She was really nice. I didn't get the internship, but she gave me feedback afterwards.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Technical Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Clinton Health Access Initiative in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied the position online in Nov 2015 and was shortlisted in Dec. The first Interview call was with HR, asked personal and professional questions related to job profile and CV and then they gave an excel sheet task which was submitted within the period asked for.
Interview Questions: Background and CV

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Clinton Health Access Initiative (New Delhi) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions:
4 rounds 
1 Mini Case on phone
1 Behavioral Interview 
1 HR Interview
1 Interview with Country Director
It won't be hard for people with a passion for and background in healthcare. You have to demonstrate the ability to work with public sector officials.
Interview Questions: Why CHAI? This is very important for them

title: Senior Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Clinton Health Access Initiative (Boston, MA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: I responded to the job posting online and was contacted via email by an HR representative located abroad. We arranged for a phone interview. Following the phone interview I was asked to conduct a case study (3 hours timed) and submit it within 48 hours of completion of the phone interview. I have yet to be contacted. That was 1 month ago.
Interview Questions: How do you handle a situation when multiple stakeholders disagree about how to evaluate a program?

title: Technical Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Clinton Health Access Initiative (Brooklyn, NY) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions:
First, general HR interview (character fit, work style, how you heard of CHAI, etc.)
Then, skills test (case study with analysis and presentation) -- Very basic
Then, interview with senior associate (1:1) -- More work-style questions
Then, interview with senior manager (1:1) - More work-style questions with very basic technical questions
Finally, interview with directors (group) -- All work-style questions
Interview Questions: How does the job description align with previous experiences? How do you deal with stress? Describe your thought process while working through case study. Describe your organization style. Describe your analytical competencies. How do you see your future? What do you want to get out of this? How do you manage conflicting views between colleagues with different roles?

title: Technical Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Clinton Health Access Initiative
Interview Descriptions: At least 3 interviews for any position. The first was with HR, the second was with the overall program manager, and the third was with the in-country team. The HR served a s a screening and was quite simple; the second served as a position-specific interview that looked more at my background. The third was the most difficult and lasted nearly an hour. It examined my ability to work with the in-country team.
Interview Questions: Time management, ability to work independently.

title: Technical Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Clinton Health Access Initiative in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: The three times I got interviewed I had applied  online.  Always have the first interview by a recruiter/HR and two out of three I had a overall good experience. Being questioned things like "how to deal with multicultural issues in a team" or "why working for CHAI". They inform you about CHAI worldwide and about payment. Only in the first time I got to the subsequent interviews (a technical one, which was in a very nice way, like discussing the technical needs and asking me how I could collaborate and participate on that) and after that, an interview with the regional coordinator, regarding  project management and international funding.
Interview Questions: Why working for CHAI?

title: Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Clinton Health Access Initiative in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: I completed 5 interviews and one technical exercise for CHAI. The first interview, with HR, gauged fit with the organizational culture and asked general behavioral questions, etc. I then was asked to complete a timed technical exercise comprising a case with quantitative and qualitative analysis (deliverables were an Excel workbook, PPT, and memo in Word). About one month lapsed after I submitted the technical exercise before I was contacted again to do interviews with the team. One of the 4 team interviews involved an oral case component. Some team members were local, others were abroad, at varying levels in the organization. Three of the team interviews were by phone and one in person.
Interview Questions: What would you do if the donor for this project asked CHAI to prove the impact their funding has had but we didn't have the data to quantify their impact on their preferred indicator?

title: Programmer Officer In Africa Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Clinton Health Access Initiative
Interview Descriptions: Pretty hard as different people in the organisations will interview you, where as they have different views on who is needed for the job. Incompetent HR I should say, organisation quite uninformed about development projects. Young managers with Ivy League pedigree who have never been to Africa.
Interview Questions: Quantitative questions

title: Senior Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Clinton Health Access Initiative
Interview Descriptions: The interview was largely behavioral questions. In particular, it helped to know current employees at the company who can put in a good word. Other applicants are typically asked to analyze data and prepare a powerpoint presentation. You will be asked to discuss similar work experience, which is standard practice. Applicants with past consulting experience is a plus.
Interview Questions: Case question related to international health

title: Program Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Clinton Health Access Initiative
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by phone first after I had applied online, this lasted about 45 minutes. I received a call for a face to face interview after about a week, the panel consisted of 3 people and I was asked competence based questions this lasted about an hour, and the questions were very detailed and demanded a lot of detail in the answers. Two weeks after the interview I was called in to be interviewed by the Country Director this was short and informal.
Interview Questions: How do you maintain professional relationships

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Clinton Health Access Initiative
Interview Descriptions: Interview over skype with a regional HR officer based in Africa. I received an interview invitation a few weeks later after I applied online. Skype connection was not as bad as imagined but I felt awkward to ask to repeat questions again and again. The interview lasted about an hour followed by a technical written assignment (excel, ppt, word) which I was asked to submit within two days after the interview. After the written assignment, the HR officer told me that he would give a feedback /result in a week but he never did.
Interview Questions: Interview questions were normal; what I know about the organization, some of my experiences picked up from resume, behavioral case question, salary requirement, visa status etc. A written assignment was rather difficult as I was not familiar with quantitative analysis.

title: Senior Program Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Clinton Health Access Initiative (Harare) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied online was called after a month for a Skype screening talk. After that I got a case study to do and heard from the office in about 2 weeks. Went for an interview with some of the team members and was called again after a month with an invite to meet the country rep.
Interview Questions:
Why CHAI.
Why me etc

title: Public Health Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Clinton Health Access Initiative in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Contacted following referral for a blanket first round interview. Asked general resume questions about previous experience, then asked a few "tell us about a time when...you showed leadership/caused a change in culture/etc."
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time when you worked in a resource-poor setting.

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Clinton Health Access Initiative (Boston, MA) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions:
3 stage interview, CHAI fit interview; Questions include 
Career background, Personal Statements and Future plans.
 MS excel test, 
Team panel interview; this was more role focused interview, the panel had existing team members, a lot of the questions targeted meeting the advertised role.
Interview Questions: Give a brief career history? Do you understand the advertised role? How do you fit into the role?

title: Senior Program Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Clinton Health Access Initiative (Abuja, Federal Capital Territory) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: 4 stage interview. Initial HR interview to determine eligibility, followed by test of excel skills in which a case study is presented and results are expected to be summarized in excel format. A memo is also expected to be written and submitted based on the excel result. 3rd stage is a technical program interview. Final interview was with senior management
Interview Questions:
Describe yourself and why you are appropriate for this job
You move around a lot,can you stay on a job?
What do you know about under 5 mortality in Nigeria?

title: Country Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Clinton Health Access Initiative (Washington, DC) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: There were three interviews in total, the last one being in-person. The first one was a telephone interview with general HR staff; second one (telephone) was with a technical person working overseas. I was then asked to complete a task in 48 hours about a hypothetical country that would demonstrate my ability to use Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint. The final one was in Washington D.C. with another technical person. They paid the airfare and hotel stay. The whole process took about 4-6 weeks.
Interview Questions: "If you are working in country X and you need to do a surveillance study on Y and need to incorporate GIS in your findings, how would you go about it?"

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Clinton Health Access Initiative in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was first contacted by a HQ based hiring manager, we set up a phone interview and discussed a few points about the organization and the position and then was asked about my specific work history and experience as well as behavioral interview style questions. I was given a timed technical exercise to complete (data analysis with MS Excel, one page report and 5 PPT slides). This was followed by a panel interview with people from the country office and regional/international posts.
Interview Questions: I was asked what I know/like about the organization, I had a short answer but was pressed to continue and talk more about the organization

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Clinton Health Access Initiative
Interview Descriptions: They gave me a case to solve over the phone because most of the senior managers were McKinsey alums. Then I interviewed via phone with the country director and the regional director.
Interview Questions: The case was difficult - but the interview questions were behavioral based.

title: Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Clinton Health Access Initiative
Interview Descriptions: After applying online the initial phone interview occurred in a timely manner. It took about 30 minutes and questions were fairly standard. However they did ask what my favorite function in excel was. I was told there would be 3 additional interviews/case studies. However no further communications have been received from CHAI.
Interview Questions: What is your favorite excel function.

title: Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Clinton Health Access Initiative (New York, NY) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: The process begins with a phone screen with an HR rep. The next step is a case study in which you are required to conduct an analysis and prepare a presentation of your findings to a tailored audience.  The purpose of the case study is to assess your familiarity with excel and communication. The last step is conversation(s) 1:1 with your manager(s).  Some teams require that you also speak with the director.
Interview Questions:
Why public health?
Why Clinton Health Access Initiative?
What are your greatest strengths/weaknesses working in teams?

title: Senior Health Financing Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Clinton Health Access Initiative (Addis Ababa) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Three interviews with  a recruitment agency, program manager and deputy country director.average level, not well organized it took 8 months. There was an online quez question before the interview which was tough.
Interview Questions: If your boss gave  you an assignment about something that you have no idea but has a short dedline,  what would you do?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Clinton Health Access Initiative in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Applied for a position advertised online. I was later emailed asking if I would be interested in a different position that they were hiring for and , if so, to provide college transcripts. Interview with program staff and HR followed by second interview with HR Manager.
Interview Questions: Questions surrounded ability to cultivate and nurture good working relationships

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Clinton Health Access Initiative
Interview Descriptions:
I applied through the online site (although most people I now know within the organization got their jobs through an internal contact).  About 2 months after submitting my application online, I was contacted by HR, who conducted a ~30minute phone screen.  She established the salary range that I could expect right away, and then proceeded to ask me behavioral questions and questions based on my resume.

She set up a time for me to do a timed Excel test, which was very simple if you are well versed in Excel.  ~2 weeks after that, I did a McKinsey type case interview with a current employee to assess my strategic thinking.  After this, I did 3 more interviews with others who were on my team.  Most of the questions were about my experience and motivation.
Interview Questions: I was surprised that they sent an Excel test.  It took about 1-2 hours to complete because there are several parts to the question, but it's not a challenging exercise.
